Bash(gh issue create --title "Auth: Implement Google OAuth with Supabase" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Phase 1: Foundation

### Description
Implement Google sign-in as the primary authentication method using Supabase Auth.

### Specifications (from requirements)
- No password storage or password reset flows
- Quick onboarding (sign in → start using)
- On first login, create a user profile record
- Session handling: secure cookies/JWT managed by Supabase

### Tasks
- [ ] Configure Google OAuth in Supabase dashboard
- [ ] Implement sign-in page with Google OAuth button
- [ ] Create user profile on first login
- [ ] Set up protected routes and middleware
- [ ] Implement sign-out functionality
- [ ] Add session persistence
- [ ] Handle OAuth callback and errors

### Acceptance Criteria
- Users can sign in with Google
- User profile is created automatically on first login
- Protected routes redirect unauthenticated users
- Sessions persist across page refreshes
- Sign out works correctly

### Labels
foundation, auth, phase-1
EOF
)" --label "foundation,auth,phase-1")

Bash(gh issue edit 9 --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Phase 3: Automation

### Description
UPDATED: This issue focuses on meeting recurrence configuration only (no automatic generation).

### Implementation Decisions
✅ **Users control meeting creation** - Meetings are created manually from user''s own calendar (Google/Outlook)
✅ **Recurrence config for reference** - Users can configure recurrence patterns for documentation purposes
✅ **No automatic meeting generation** - Users maintain full calendar control

### Features
- Configure recurring meeting patterns (weekly, fortnightly, monthly, custom)
- Link recurrence patterns to people (1:1s) or teams (team syncs)
- Display next expected meeting date (for reference)
- Mark meetings as part of a recurring series
- Pause/resume recurrence tracking

### Tasks
- [ ] Create meeting_recurrences data model
- [ ] Build recurrence configuration UI
- [ ] Add recurrence pattern display
- [ ] Show "next expected meeting" indicator
- [ ] Implement pause/resume functionality
- [ ] Link meetings to recurrence patterns
- [ ] Add recurrence status indicators
- [ ] Create recurrence management page

### Acceptance Criteria
- Users can configure recurrence patterns for reference
- Recurrence patterns are linked to meetings
- No automatic meeting creation occurs
- Users maintain full control of their calendar
- Next expected meeting date is displayed

**Labels: phase-3, meetings, automation**
EOF
)")
